intro: Libanotis turajgyrica, commonly known as the Turajgyi bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Caucasus region. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry habitats, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its drought resistance. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
